result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. WURM II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment/schooling combination or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 03-31-16 at 8:45 a.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 02-18-16 at 3:15 p.m.
Attorney Nitsch advises the court that the defendant is Thomas M. Wurm II and asks that the complaint be amended.  State has no objection.  Court grants the amendment.
Minutes.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC, possess drug paraphernalia and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
